title: RC Unterföhring
text:
The Rugby Club Unterföhring is a German <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> from <a href="Munich%20district">Munich district</a>, currently playing in the <a href="2nd%20Rugby-Bundesliga">2nd Rugby-Bundesliga</a> and with a second team in the Verbandsliga Bayern. It is based in <a href="Unterf%C3%B6hring">Unterföhring</a>, the closest suburb to Munich city centre. Since January 2017 the RCU is the second biggest rugby club in Bavaria with 240 members.
Also Unterföhring was the smallest municipality in Germany with its own rugby union club. from 2012 until 2016.
After the promotion to the 2. Bundesliga in 2016/17 Unterföhring is the only village (German: Gemeinde) in the history of German rugby to have ever played in a Bundesliga. All other clubs where always based in towns or cities (German: Stadt) or army bases.
The RCU also has a growing youth section and the club is the fourth biggest club with kids under 14 years old in all of Germany. The RCU has secured championships in the Under 8, Under 10 and Under 12 age groups in recent years, as well as runners-up in U8, U10, U12 and U14. The RCU youth teams are known for consistently being able to field complete sides in the Bavarian youth competition.
Founded in 2016 the RCU also has a women's team playing in the Deutsche 7er-Liga Frauen Süd.
Facilities.
The RCU plays their home-games on the rugby pitch in Unterföhring am Etzweg. In 2021/22 the RCU will move to the new Unterföhring sports complex, where there will be a grass pitch only for rugby as well as a shared artificial pitch, making it the Bavarian club with the best facilities.
